Create core metadata templates

Source: R/template_core_metadata.R
template_core_metadata.Rd

Use this function to create the core metadata templates required by all data packages. Most templates require user supplied information. Instructions for editing these templates.

template_core_metadata(
      path,
      license,
      file.type = '.txt',
      write.file = TRUE,
      x = NULL
    )

Arguments

path

(character) Path to the metadata template directory.
license

(character) License to publicly release the data package under. Use "CC0" or "CCBY".
file.type

(character; optional) File type for abstract, methods, and additional info metadata templates. Can be: '.txt' (plain text), '.docx' (MS Word), or '.md' (markdown).
write.file

(logical; optional) Whether to write the template files.
x

(named list; optional) Alternative input to template_core_metadatta(). Use template_arguments() to create x.

Value

  • abstract The abstract template.

  • additional_info The template for miscellaneous information.

  • intellectual_rights.txt The intellectual rights license with the text of CC0 or CCBY.

  • keywords.txt The tab delimited keywords template.

  • methods The methods template.

  • personnel.txt The tab delimited personnel template for information on persons and funding involved in the creation of the data package.

  • These files is written to path unless using x, in which case the templates are added to /x/templates.

Details

Existing templates will not be overwritten by template_core_metadata().

Examples

# Initialize data package directory for template_core_metadata()
file.copy(
  from = system.file('/examples/pkg_250', package = 'EMLassemblyline'),
  to = tempdir(),
  recursive = TRUE
)
#> [1] TRUE

# Set working directory
setwd(paste0(tempdir(), '/pkg_250'))

# View directory contents (NOTE: Directory is empty)
dir('./metadata_templates')
#> [1] "README.txt"

# Template core metadata
template_core_metadata(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  license = 'CC0'
)
#> Templating core metadata ...
#> abstract.txt
#> additional_info.txt
#> intellectual_rights.txt
#> keywords.txt.
#> methods.txt
#> personnel.txt
#> Done.

# View directory contents (NOTE: Templates exist)
dir('./metadata_templates')
#> [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
#> [3] "intellectual_rights.txt" "keywords.txt"           
#> [5] "methods.txt"             "personnel.txt"          
#> [7] "README.txt"             

# Rerunning template_core_metadata() does not overwrite files
template_core_metadata(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  license = 'CC0'
)
#> Templating core metadata ...
#> abstract.txt already exists!
#> additional_info.txt already exists!
#> intellectual_rights.txt already exists!
#> keywords.txt already exists!
#> methods.txt already exists!
#> personnel.txt already exists!
#> Done.

# Use docx files for abstract, methods, and additional_info
# First remove abstract, methods, and additional_info templates
file.remove(
  c(
    './metadata_templates/abstract.txt',
    './metadata_templates/methods.txt',
    './metadata_templates/additional_info.txt'
  )
)
#> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE

# Create docx templates
template_core_metadata(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  license = 'CC0',
  file.type = '.docx'
)
#> Templating core metadata ...
#> abstract.docx
#> additional_info.docx
#> intellectual_rights.txt already exists!
#> keywords.txt already exists!
#> methods.docx
#> personnel.txt already exists!
#> Done.

# Use md files for abstract, methods, and additional_info
# First remove abstract, methods, and additional_info templates
file.remove(
  c(
    './metadata_templates/abstract.docx',
    './metadata_templates/methods.docx',
    './metadata_templates/additional_info.docx'
  )
)
#> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE

# Create md templates
template_core_metadata(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  license = 'CC0',
  file.type = '.md'
)
#> Templating core metadata ...
#> abstract.md
#> additional_info.md
#> intellectual_rights.txt already exists!
#> keywords.txt already exists!
#> methods.md
#> personnel.txt already exists!
#> Done.

# Clean up
unlink('.', recursive = TRUE)
